definition: to be familiar with/to know well
cooked (of food)/ripe (of fruit)/mature (of seeds)/familiar/skilled/done/also pr. [shou2]
in all cases/know

sentences.english: But I can do it with my eyes closed.
sentences.chinese: 但我熟悉得闭着眼睛都能做。

sentences.english: If I were to add the word pigmy, ring a bell?
sentences.chinese: 如果我加上词，矮人，听起来熟悉吗？

sentences.english: This is a flower familiar to many of us.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们都很熟悉的一种花。

sentences.english: A frend is going to visit a girl you know well.
sentences.chinese: 一个朋友正准备去看望你很熟悉的一个女孩子。

sentences.english: The basic structure of the Ice and Fire books is familiar enough.
sentences.chinese: 《冰与火之歌》的基本脉络大家一定都很熟悉了。

sentences.english: Most readers are probably familiar with the Dilbert comic strip.
sentences.chinese: 很多读者可能对Dilbert连环画都很熟悉。

sentences.english: Have knowledge of computer hardware, software, network setting and maintenance.
sentences.chinese: 熟悉计算机硬件，软件，开发包网络设计和维护。

sentences.english: Of the various forms of discourse narration is perhaps the most familiar to us.
sentences.chinese: 记叙文是我们最为熟悉的一种写作文体。

sentences.english: I started walking down an unfamiliar road. There was not a soul there.
sentences.chinese: 我开始沿着一条不熟悉的道路前行，连个人影都没有。

sentences.english: This was due mainly to our wanting to use tools that the client's architect was familiar with.
sentences.chinese: 这主要是由于我们想使用客户的架构师所熟悉的工具。

sentences.english: You seem to know this place vell well. Have you been here before?
sentences.chinese: 看来你非常熟悉这个地方，你以前来过这里吗？

sentences.english: And according to the Daily Princetonian, you're familiar with.
sentences.chinese: 根据普林斯顿日报，你应该很熟悉了。

sentences.english: to go and actually learn, learn the city and learn the roads.
sentences.chinese: 真正地去学习，熟悉这座城市，熟悉这些道路。

sentences.english: to go and actually learn, learn the city and learn the roads.
sentences.chinese: 真正地去学习，熟悉这座城市，熟悉这些道路。

definition: strange/unfamiliar
to be well acquainted with
to know/to recognize/to be familiar with/to get acquainted with sb/knowledge/understanding/awareness/cognition
what's frequently heard can be repeated in detail (idiom)
amiable/cordial/close and dear/familiar
déjà vu (the experience of seeing exactly the same situation a second time)/seemingly familiar/apparently already acquainted
presumably/probably/in all likelihood/surely
to be convinced (that sth is true)/to believe/to accept sth as true
to mention/to bring up (a subject)/with regard to/as for
practiced/proficient/skilled/skillful
clear/distinct/to understand thoroughly/to be clear about
clear/distinct
to know sth like the back of one's hand (idiom)/to know (a person, a place etc) inside out
variant of 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
everyone/influential family/great expert
to know/to become aware of/also pr. [zhi1 dao5]
to remember/to bear in mind/to learn by heart
